metadata.titleEn: Dataset on atmospheric water cycle changes and the impact in a key area of the Tibetan Plateau under the background of global warming (2008)
metadata.titleCn: 全球变化背景下青藏高原关键区水份循环特征变化及其影响作用数据集（2008）
metadata.description:
The assessment of changes in the atmospheric water cycle and the associated impacts in a key area of the Tibetan Plateau under the background of the global warming was a major component of the research project “The Environmental and Ecological Science of West China” run by the National Natural Science Foundation of China. The leading executive of the project was Xiangde Xu from the Chinese Academy of Meteorological Sciences. The project ran from January 2006 to December 2008.

The following data were collected by the project of the Sino-Japan Joint Research Center of Meteorological Disaster (JICA Project):
1. Observation category, time period and number of stations
1) JICA AWS data: From January to July of 2008, 73 automatic stations (including 5 automatic stations of the Chinese Academy of Sciences) collected data in Tibet, Yunnan, Sichuan and other provinces or autonomous regions. 
2) JICA GPS water vapour data: From January to October of 2008, 24 observation stations collected data in Tibet, Yunnan, Sichuan and other provinces or autonomous regions.
3) JICA encrypted observation GPS sonde data: From March to July of 2008, observations were made in Tibet, Yunnan, Sichuan and other provinces or autonomous regions (detailed observation time and location data can be found in the data catalogue).
2. Observation categories, data content
1) GPS water vapour
Data content: serial number, station name (Chinese), station number, longitude, latitude, altitude, year, month, day, time, surface pressure, surface air temperature, relative humidity, total delay (m), precipitation (cm) (Measurement interval: 1 hour).
2) GPS encrypted sonde
 Data content: air pressure P, temperature T, relative humidity RH, V component, U component, vertical height H, dew point temperature Td, water vapour content Mr, wind direction Wd, wind speed Ws, longitude Lon, latitude Lat, radar height RdH.
A value of "-999.90" means no observation data.
3) AWS
Data content: station number, longitude, latitude, elevation, site level, total cloud volume, wind direction, wind speed, sea level pressure, 3-hour pressure variable, past weather 1, past weather 2, 6-hour precipitation, low cloud form, low cloud volume, low cloud height, dew point, visibility, current weather, temperature, medium cloud form, high cloud form, 24-hour temperature variable, 24-hour pressure variable.

background: The tropopause is the transition between the troposphere and stratosphere; both have fundamentally different characteristics with respect to chemical processes and dynamical regimes. The tropopause acts as a “two‐way gate” for the exchange of mass, water vapor, and chemical species between troposphere and stratosphere. Since the vertical transport of water vapor and chemical compositions from the troposphere‐stratosphere exchange affects the radiative flux balance in the upper troposphere and lower stratosphere, the tropopause plays an important role in the dynamical, radiative, and climate change. As a sensitive indicator of climate variability and global change, the tropopause height itself has received much attention in recent years. Using reanalysis data and climate model simulations, Santer et al. [2000, 2003] and Sausen and Santer [2003] pointed out that tropopause height is closely associated with tropospheric warming and stratospheric cooling. During the last decades, the global mean tropopause height has shown an increase in reanalysis and radiosonde observations. However, either radiosonde or reanalysis data suffers from lower resolution and attendant biases. Over the Tibetan Plateau (TP hereafter), radiosonde stations are sparsely located in the eastern half where the average altitude is pretty low compared with the average elevation of the TP that is over 4500 m above sea level and sometimes called “the roof of the world.” The spatial and temporal scarcity of available observations limits the studies on the characteristics of the tropopause over the TP. As “the global water tower,” the TP is the main pathway for water vapor cross‐tropopause transport, which exerts a major influence on the energy balance of the Earth‐atmosphere system despite its low abundance in the stratosphere. Also, the TP is one of the most sensitive regions to global climate change.
research objective: In this study, we attempt to compare the tropopause height over the TP with that over the same latitudinal plain (hereinafter referred to as the Plain) on the basis of the Formosa Satellite 3 (FORMOSAT‐3)/Constellation Observing System for Meteorology, Ionosphere, and Climate (COSMIC) data.
challenges: However, either radiosonde or reanalysis data suffers from lower resolution and attendant biases. Over the Tibetan Plateau (TP hereafter), radiosonde stations are sparsely located in the eastern half where the average altitude is pretty low compared with the average elevation of the TP that is over 4500 m above sea level and sometimes called “the roof of the world.” In addition, the temporal frequency of radiosonde observations is also fairly low with 12 h intervals per day as well as substantial changes in instrumentation over time. The spatial and temporal scarcity of available observations limits the studies on the characteristics of the tropopause over the TP.
methods: In this study, the COSMIC temperature profiles from June 2006 to December 2009 with 100 m vertical resolution recorded in level 2 postprocessed wetPrf product provide by the UCAR COSMIC Data Analysis and Archive Center (CDAAC) are used. We only consider those profiles that pass quality control and all the valid profiles have been applied unweighted running average among five vertically adjacent points to reduce uncertainty stemming from RO measurements. In section 3, the climatological means, differences, and anomalies of temperatures over the TP (30°–35°N, 87°–95°E) and the Plain (30°–35°N, 112°–120°E) regions are compared. In section 4, a collocation requirement is employed to match the ROs in the Plain region with those in the TP region for further comparison. Using the valid data, we interpolate COSMIC RO retrieved temperatures to the radiosonde stations at the same levels. The comparisons of the temperatures from COSMIC and radiosondes are then made over the TP and the Plain, respectively.
dataset: Using Constellation Observing System for Meteorology, Ionosphere, and Climate (COSMIC) radio occultation data from June 2006 to December 2009, the temperature structure and the tropopause height over the Tibetan Plateau (TP) is studied in this paper.
findings: The temperature over the TP is warmer and experiences a larger magnitude of change than that over the same latitudinal plain area (hereinafter referred to as the Plain) at the same level of lower troposphere. The lapse rate tropopause (LRT) shows a strong correlation with thermal properties of the atmosphere. Its height variation is anticorrelated with its temperature, highest at ∼19 km and coldest at approximately −72°C in boreal summer, but lowest at ∼13 km and approximately −56°C in boreal winter. The LRT height is also strongly dependent on the subtropical jet that is associated with the tropopause fold and/or multiple tropopauses, leading to fairly bimodal distribution of the LRT probability density function. As the “roof of the world,” the elevated topography of the TP dynamically lifts the CPT to a higher altitude without significantly seasonal variations. Along the latitude of 32.5°N the CPT is located at ∼18 km over the main body of the TP and drops to ∼15 km over the Plain. Given the area in the TP (30°–35°N, 87°–95°E) as well as in the Plain (30°–35°N, 112°–120°E), the CPT primarily resides at 17–18 km, 72.52% over the TP and 69.22% over the Plain. Their monthly mean difference can reach 1.4 km for the complete analysis period.
backgroundCn: 对流层顶是对流层和平流层之间的过渡层；这两者在化学过程和动力学机制上具有根本性的不同特征。对流层顶充当“双向门”，用于对流层和平流层之间的质量、水蒸气和化学物质的交换。由于水蒸气和化学成分的垂直输送影响了上对流层和下平流层的辐射通量平衡，因此对流层顶在动力学、辐射和气候变化中发挥着重要作用。作为气候变异和全球变化的敏感指示器，对流层顶高度近年来受到广泛关注。Santer等人（2000年、2003年）和Sausen与Santer（2003年）利用再分析数据和气候模型模拟指出，对流层顶高度与对流层的变暖和平流层的冷却密切相关。在过去几十年中，全球平均对流层顶高度在再分析和气象探测观测中显示出增加的趋势。然而，无论是气象探测还是再分析数据都存在较低的分辨率和随之而来的偏差。在青藏高原（以下简称TP）上，气象探测站在东半部稀疏分布，平均海拔相对较低，而TP的平均海拔超过4500米，有时被称为“世界屋脊”。可用观测数据的空间和时间稀缺限制了对TP地区对流层顶特征的研究。作为“全球水塔”，TP是水蒸气跨对流层输送的主要通道，尽管其在平流层中的丰度较低，但对地球-大气系统的能量平衡产生了重大影响。此外，TP是全球气候变化最敏感的地区之一。
research objectiveCn: 在本研究中，我们尝试基于福尔摩沙卫星3号（FORMOSAT‐3）/气象、电离层和气候观测系统（COSMIC）数据比较青藏高原（TP）与同纬度平原（以下简称平原）上的对流层顶高度。
challengesCn: 然而，无论是探空仪还是再分析数据都存在分辨率较低和相关偏差的问题。在青藏 Plateau（以下简称TP）上，探空仪站在东半部稀疏分布，而该地区的平均海拔相对较低，与TP的平均海拔4500米以上相比，后者有时被称为“世界屋脊”。此外，探空观测的时间频率也相对较低，每天只有12小时的间隔，并且随着时间的推移，仪器设备也发生了显著变化。可用观测数据的空间和时间稀缺限制了对TP上对流层顶特征的研究。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，使用了由UCAR COSMIC数据分析与归档中心（CDAAC）提供的2006年6月至2009年12月期间的COSMIC温度剖面数据，该数据具有100米的垂直分辨率，属于二级后处理的wetPrf产品。我们仅考虑那些通过质量控制的剖面，所有有效剖面均采用五个垂直相邻点的无权重滑动平均，以减少源自RO测量的不确定性。在第3节中，比较了青藏高原（TP，30°–35°N，87°–95°E）和平原（30°–35°N，112°–120°E）地区的温度气候平均值、差异和异常。在第4节中，采用了配对要求，将平原地区的RO与青藏高原地区的RO进行匹配，以便进行进一步比较。使用有效数据，我们将COSMIC RO获取的温度插值到相同层次的气象探空站。然后分别比较青藏高原和平原地区的COSMIC温度与气象探空数据。
datasetCn: 本文利用2006年6月至2009年12月的恒星际气象、离子层和气候观测系统（COSMIC）无线电掩蔽数据，研究了青藏高原（TP）的温度结构和对流层顶高度。
findingsCn: 青藏 Plateau（TP）上的温度较高，且变化幅度大于同一纬度平原区域（以下简称“平原”）在下层对流层相同高度的温度。温度梯度平流层顶（LRT）与大气的热力学特性呈强相关。其高度变化与温度呈反相关，夏季在约19公里处最高，温度约为−72°C，而冬季在约13公里处最低，温度约为−56°C。LRT高度还强烈依赖于与平流层顶折叠和/或多个平流层顶相关的亚热带急流，导致LRT概率密度函数呈现出相当的双峰分布。作为“世界屋脊”，青藏 Plateau的高海拔地形动态地将对流层顶（CPT）抬升到更高的高度，且季节变化不显著。在32.5°N的纬度上，CPT位于TP的主要部分约为18公里，而在平原上降至约15公里。考虑到TP（30°–35°N，87°–95°E）和平原（30°–35°N，112°–120°E）区域，CPT主要位于17–18公里，TP上为72.52%，平原上为69.22%。在整个分析期间，它们的月均差异可达到1.4公里。

background: The land surface soil moisture is a crucial variable in weather and climate models. The soil moisture is an essential variable that governs the interactions between the land surface and the atmosphere. The soil moisture controls the ratio of the runoff to infiltration, controls the surface energy partition, and influences the development of vegetation and the carbon cycle. The soil moisture-precipitation feedback tendency has been identified. Satellite remote sensing provides the opportunity to measure the surface soil moisture at the regional, continental and even global scales. Passive microwave remote sensing provides a means for the direct measurement of the surface soil moisture at a coarse resolution and with a frequent temporal coverage. However, in the field of weather forecast and hydrology modeling, a finer temporal resolution would obviously improve the accuracy and reliability of the forecast. Numerical models can provide continuous estimates of soil moisture over the entire soil profile at any scale. However, due to the model initialization, the parameter and forcing errors, and the inadequate model physics and/or resolution, the model predictions are usually of low quality. The LDAS, which merges the observation information (which includes in situ measurements and satellite remote sensing data) into a dynamic model (i.e., LSM), is expected to provide high-quality surface energy and water flux estimates with adequate spatial coverage and resolution for weather forecast. Because the LDAS can make maximum usage of the observation data that are derived from satellite remote sensing, it is expected to improve the land surface water and energy simulations, especially in the ungauged and poorly gauged regions. The Tibetan Plateau plays an important role in the progression of the Asian summer monsoon through its strong land-atmosphere interactions; it also influences circulations over China, the Northern Hemisphere and even the entire globe. Understanding the land-atmosphere interaction over the plateau is essential for weather forecast and climate change studies.
research objective: The objective of this study was to develop an LDAS over the Tibetan Plateau by merging passive microwave remote sensing data and GCM output into a land surface model and to investigate the potential of the LDAS to improve the simulations of the land surface soil moisture and the energy flux.
challenges: This unstable performance was not an uncommon case for satellite retrievals, and hinders the application of the AMSR-E soil moisture products worldwide. We believe this result was caused by the strong forcing errors that were inherited from the biased rainfall input, and we suggest that reasonable forcing data are needed to properly estimate the temporal variations. Both the LDAS and the SiB2 overestimated the sensible heat flux, which is partly due to that LSM does not accounting for the excess resistance that is important for the sensible heat flux calculation (Yang et al., 2009), and should be addressed in future research.
methods: This system was applied over the Tibetan Plateau, using the National Centers for Environmental Prediction (NCEP) reanalysis data as forcing data and the Advanced Microwave Scanning Radiometers for EOS (AMSR-E) brightness temperatures as an observation. The AMSR-E brightness temperature data and the NCEP reanalysis data were assimilated into the SiB2. In order to evaluate the capability of the assimilation system, the LDAS products, the SiB2 simulations, the NCEP simulations, and the AMSR-E retrievals were compared against the in situ observations.
dataset: The data that were observed at the Gaize and Naqu stations were used in this study; these data were obtained from the Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA) China-Japan climate disasters mitigation project (JICA project). Gaize station (32◦18′N, 84◦06′E, 4416 m asl) is located in the middle of western Plateau, where the dry climate is dominant. Naqu station (32◦22′N, 91◦54′ E, 4509 m asl) is located in the central Plateau, and it experiences a wet climate condition during the monsoon season. The soil moisture that was measured with an horizontally installed TDR probe at a 5-cm depth from the surface was used for the surface soil moisture validation. The National Centers for Environmental Prediction/National Center for Atmospheric Research (NCEP/NCAR) reanalysis is a global reanalysis that was initiated in 1948 and continues to the near real-time at a horizontal resolution of T62 and a temporal resolution of 6 h. The brightness temperatures of the AMSR-E that were observed at 6.925 GHz and 18.7 GHz were used as the observation data in the LDAS.
findings: For the surface soil moisture, the LDAS simulations were superior to both NCEP and SiB2, and there was more than a one-third reduction in the root mean squared errors (RMSE) for both of the stations. Compared with the AMSR-E soil moisture retrievals, the LDAS simulations were comparable at the Gaize station, and they were superior at the Naqu station. For the whole domain inter-comparison, the results showed that the LDAS simulation of the soil moisture field was more realistic than the NCEP and SiB2 simulations and that the LDAS could estimate land surface states properly even in the regions where AMSR-E failed to cover and/or during the periods that the satellite did not overpass. For the surface energy fluxes, the LDAS estimated the latent heat flux with an acceptable accuracy (RMSE less than 35 W/m2), with a one-third reduction in the RMSE from the SiB2. For the 5-month whole plateau simulation, the LDAS produced a much more reasonable Bowen Ratio than the NCEP, and it also generated a clear contrast of the land surface status over the plateau, which was wet in the southeast and dry in the northwest, during the monsoon and post-monsoon seasons.
backgroundCn: 地表土壤湿度是天气和气候模型中的一个关键变量。土壤湿度是一个重要变量，控制着陆地表面与大气之间的相互作用。土壤湿度控制着径流与入渗的比率，控制着表面能量的分配，并影响植被的发展和碳循环。土壤湿度与降水之间的反馈趋势已被识别。卫星遥感提供了在区域、大陆甚至全球范围内测量表层土壤湿度的机会。被动微波遥感提供了一种直接测量表层土壤湿度的方法，具有较粗的分辨率和频繁的时间覆盖。然而，在天气预报和水文建模领域，更细的时间分辨率显然会提高预报的准确性和可靠性。数值模型可以在任何尺度上提供整个土壤剖面的土壤湿度连续估计。然而，由于模型初始化、参数和强迫误差，以及模型物理和/或分辨率不足，模型预测通常质量较低。LDAS（陆地数据同化系统）将观测信息（包括现场测量和卫星遥感数据）与动态模型（即陆面模型）相结合，预计能够提供高质量的表面能量和水通量估计，具有足够的空间覆盖和分辨率，以用于天气预报。由于LDAS可以最大限度地利用来自卫星遥感的观测数据，预计将改善陆地表面水和能量的模拟，特别是在无水文站和水文站稀缺的地区。青藏高原在亚洲夏季季风的发展中发挥着重要作用，通过其强烈的陆气相互作用；它还影响着中国、北半球乃至全球的环流。理解高原上的陆气相互作用对于天气预报和气候变化研究至关重要。
research objectiveCn: 本研究的目的是通过将被动微波遥感数据和全球气候模型（GCM）输出合并到陆面模型中，开发一个覆盖青藏高原的陆面数据同化系统（LDAS），并研究该LDAS在改善土壤湿度和能量通量模拟方面的潜力。
challengesCn: 这种不稳定的表现并不是卫星遥感结果中罕见的情况，阻碍了AMSR-E土壤湿度产品在全球范围内的应用。我们认为这一结果是由于偏差降雨输入所继承的强迫误差所致，我们建议需要合理的强迫数据来正确估计时间变化。LDAS和SiB2都高估了显热通量，这部分是由于陆面模型（LSM）没有考虑对显热通量计算重要的过剩阻力（Yang et al., 2009），这一问题应在未来的研究中加以解决。
methodsCn: 该系统应用于青藏高原，使用国家环境预报中心（NCEP）再分析数据作为强迫数据，并使用先进微波扫描辐射仪（AMSR-E）亮温作为观测数据。AMSR-E亮温数据和NCEP再分析数据被同化到SiB2模型中。为了评估同化系统的能力，将LDAS产品、SiB2模拟、NCEP模拟和AMSR-E反演结果与现场观测进行了比较。
datasetCn: 本研究使用了在Gaize和Naqu站点观察到的数据，这些数据来自于日本国际协力机构（JICA）中日气候灾害减缓项目（JICA项目）。Gaize站（32°18′N，84°06′E，海拔4416米）位于西部高原中部，干燥气候占主导。Naqu站（32°22′N，91°54′E，海拔4509米）位于高原中央，在季风季节经历湿润气候条件。使用在距地表5厘米深处水平安装的TDR探头测量的土壤湿度进行表层土壤湿度验证。国家环境预报中心/国家大气研究中心（NCEP/NCAR）再分析是一个自1948年启动并持续至近实时的全球再分析，具有T62的水平分辨率和6小时的时间分辨率。AMSR-E在6.925 GHz和18.7 GHz频率下观测到的亮温被用作LDAS中的观测数据。
findingsCn: 对于表层土壤湿度，LDAS模拟优于NCEP和SiB2，两个站点的均方根误差（RMSE）减少了超过三分之一。与AMSR-E土壤湿度反演结果相比，LDAS模拟在Gaize站点表现相当，而在Naqu站点表现更优。在整个区域的比较中，结果显示LDAS对土壤湿度场的模拟比NCEP和SiB2的模拟更为真实，并且LDAS能够在AMSR-E未能覆盖的区域和卫星未过境的时期准确估计地表状态。对于表面能量通量，LDAS对潜热通量的估计具有可接受的准确性（RMSE小于35 W/m²），与SiB2相比，RMSE减少了三分之一。在为期5个月的整个高原模拟中，LDAS生成了比NCEP更合理的波文比，并且在季风和后季风季节，清晰地展示了高原地区的地表状态对比，东南部湿润而西北部干燥。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a dataset used to assess the water vapor transport characteristics over the Tibetan Plateau?

Example.AnswerEn: The JICA GPS water vapor dataset, which includes parameters like ground pressure, ground temperature, relative humidity, total delay, and precipitable water, collected from 24 observation stations in Tibet, Yunnan, and Sichuan, helps assess water vapor transport characteristics over the Tibetan Plateau.

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the primary challenges associated with collecting high-resolution atmospheric data over the Tibetan Plateau?

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise from using passive microwave remote sensing data to estimate soil moisture in the Tibetan Plateau, and how can these be addressed?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 使用被动微波遥感数据估计青藏高原土壤湿度可能会面临哪些挑战，以及如何应对这些挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Challenges in using passive microwave remote sensing data for soil moisture estimation include the strong forcing errors inherited from biased rainfall inputs and the coarse resolution of satellite data. These challenges can be addressed by integrating satellite data with in situ observations and dynamic models through a Land Data Assimilation System (LDAS). This approach merges different data sources to enhance the accuracy and reliability of soil moisture estimates, particularly in ungauged and poorly gauged regions like the Tibetan Plateau.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 使用被动微波遥感数据进行土壤湿度估计的挑战包括来自偏差降雨输入的强迫误差以及卫星数据的粗分辨率。这些挑战可以通过将卫星数据与地面观测和动态模型集成到陆地数据同化系统（LDAS）中来解决。这种方法融合了不同的数据源，以提高土壤湿度估计的准确性和可靠性，特别是在像青藏高原这样的无监测和监测不足的地区。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes limitations in the availability and quality of observations over the Tibetan Plateau, affecting studies on its atmospheric characteristics?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致对青藏 Plateau 的观测可用性和质量的限制的原因是什么，这影响了对其大气特征的研究？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The limitations in the availability and quality of observations over the Tibetan Plateau are primarily due to the sparse distribution of radiosonde stations, particularly in the eastern half of the plateau where average altitudes are lower than the TP's overall elevation. The infrequent temporal coverage of radiosonde observations, typically every 12 hours, and substantial changes in instrumentation over time also contribute to these limitations.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 对青藏 Plateau 观测的可用性和质量的限制主要是由于气象探空站的稀疏分布，特别是在高原东半部，那里平均海拔低于青藏 Plateau 的整体海拔。气象探空观测的时间覆盖不频繁，通常每 12 小时一次，以及仪器随时间的重大变化，也对这些限制产生了影响。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is there a need for merging passive microwave remote sensing data and GCM output into a land surface model over the Tibetan Plateau?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么需要将被动微波遥感数据和全球气候模型（GCM）输出合并到青藏 Plateau的陆面模型中？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Merging passive microwave remote sensing data and GCM output into a land surface model is necessary over the Tibetan Plateau to improve the simulation of land surface soil moisture and energy fluxes. This integration helps overcome limitations in temporal and spatial coverage, especially in ungauged and poorly gauged regions, providing high-quality surface energy and water flux estimates crucial for weather forecasting and climate change studies.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 将被动微波遥感数据与全球气候模型（GCM）输出合并到陆面模型中，对于改善青藏高原的土壤湿度和能量通量模拟是必要的。这种整合有助于克服时间和空间覆盖的局限性，特别是在无监测和监测不足的地区，提供高质量的表面能量和水通量估计，这对天气预报和气候变化研究至关重要。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the errors in soil moisture retrieval from satellite data, and how do they affect the application of these data in weather forecasting models?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 影响卫星数据土壤湿度检索误差的因素有哪些，这些误差如何影响这些数据在天气预报模型中的应用？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Errors in soil moisture retrieval from satellite data are often caused by strong forcing errors inherited from biased rainfall input. These errors can hinder the application of satellite-derived soil moisture products worldwide by affecting the accuracy of temporal variations. In weather forecasting models, such errors necessitate the use of reasonable forcing data to ensure reliable estimates of soil moisture and subsequent model predictions.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 从卫星数据中获取土壤湿度的错误通常是由于偏差降雨输入所继承的强迫误差。这些错误可能会影响全球卫星衍生土壤湿度产品的应用，影响时间变化的准确性。在天气预报模型中，这些错误需要使用合理的强迫数据，以确保土壤湿度的可靠估计和后续模型预测的准确性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential effects of incorporating GPS-based water vapor measurements on the understanding of water vapor distribution over the Tibetan Plateau?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 将基于GPS的水汽测量纳入对青藏 Plateau 水汽分布的理解可能产生的潜在影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Incorporating GPS-based water vapor measurements can enhance the understanding of water vapor distribution by providing high-resolution temporal data, which is crucial for studying the spatial and temporal scarcity of available observations over the Tibetan Plateau. This can lead to improved insights into the water vapor cross-tropopause transport and its influence on the Earth's energy balance.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 结合基于GPS的水汽测量可以增强对水汽分布的理解，因为它提供了高分辨率的时间数据，这对于研究青藏高原上可用观测的空间和时间稀缺性至关重要。这可以带来对水汽跨越对流层顶输送及其对地球能量平衡影响的更深入见解。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How might the integration of passive microwave remote sensing data with ground observations influence the accuracy of soil moisture predictions in the Tibetan Plateau region?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 被动微波遥感数据与地面观测数据的整合如何影响对青藏高原地区土壤湿度预测的准确性？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating passive microwave remote sensing data with ground observations can improve the accuracy of soil moisture predictions by reducing the root mean squared errors and providing more realistic soil moisture field simulations. This integration helps to overcome the limitations of satellite retrievals and model predictions, offering better temporal and spatial coverage.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 将被动微波遥感数据与地面观测数据相结合，可以通过减少均方根误差并提供更真实的土壤湿度场模拟来提高土壤湿度预测的准确性。这种集成有助于克服卫星反演和模型预测的局限性，提供更好的时间和空间覆盖。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the primary goal of collecting GPS water vapor data across multiple stations in the Tibetan Plateau region?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在青藏 Plateau地区收集多个站点的GPS水汽数据的主要目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal is to understand the water vapor characteristics and their variations in critical areas of the Tibetan Plateau, contributing to insights on the water cycle under global change conditions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是了解青藏高原关键区域的水汽特征及其变化，为全球变化条件下水循环的洞察提供贡献。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to employ an LDAS system that merges satellite remote sensing data with GCM outputs in research over the Tibetan Plateau?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在对青藏 Plateau 的研究中，采用将卫星遥感数据与全球气候模型（GCM）输出相结合的 LDAS 系统是重要的，原因如下：
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objective is to improve simulations of land surface soil moisture and energy flux, which are crucial for understanding land-atmosphere interactions and enhancing weather forecasts and climate change studies in this sensitive region.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是改善土壤湿度和能量通量的模拟，这对于理解陆地-大气相互作用以及提高天气预报和气候变化研究在这一敏感区域的准确性至关重要。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can passive microwave remote sensing data be integrated into a land surface model to improve soil moisture simulations over the Tibetan Plateau?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何将被动微波遥感数据集成到陆面模型中，以改善对青藏高原土壤湿度的模拟？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The integration involves using the Advanced Microwave Scanning Radiometers for EOS (AMSR-E) brightness temperatures as observation data, which are then assimilated into the SiB2 model. This process is part of a Land Data Assimilation System (LDAS) that uses the AMSR-E brightness temperature data and the National Centers for Environmental Prediction (NCEP) reanalysis data as forcing data to produce high-quality simulations of land surface soil moisture and energy flux.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 该集成涉及使用EOS的先进微波扫描辐射计（AMSR-E）亮温作为观测数据，然后将其同化到SiB2模型中。这个过程是一个土地数据同化系统（LDAS）的一部分，该系统使用AMSR-E亮温数据和国家环境预报中心（NCEP）再分析数据作为强迫数据，以生成高质量的陆面土壤湿度和能量通量模拟。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What challenges are encountered when using satellite retrievals for soil moisture estimation on the Tibetan Plateau and how can these be addressed?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在青藏高原使用卫星遥感获取土壤湿度估计时遇到的挑战有哪些，如何解决这些问题？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Challenges include strong forcing errors from biased rainfall inputs that affect satellite retrievals. These can be addressed by using reasonable forcing data. Moreover, both the LDAS and SiB2 models overestimate sensible heat flux because they do not account for excess resistance, which should be considered in future research to improve accuracy.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 挑战包括来自偏差降雨输入的强迫误差，这影响了卫星检索。这些问题可以通过使用合理的强迫数据来解决。此外，LDAS和SiB2模型都高估了显热通量，因为它们没有考虑额外的阻力，未来的研究应考虑这一点以提高准确性。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What data collection methods enable the accurate measurement of water vapor transport over high-altitude regions like the Tibetan Plateau?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些数据收集方法能够准确测量高海拔地区如青藏 Plateau 的水汽输送？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of GPS water vapor profiles and GPS radio occultation data allows for accurate measurement of water vapor transport over the Tibetan Plateau, providing valuable insights into the atmospheric dynamics of such high-altitude regions.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 使用GPS水汽剖面和GPS无线电掩蔽数据可以准确测量青藏高原上的水汽输送，为高海拔地区的大气动态提供宝贵的见解。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What challenges are typically encountered when employing satellite-based remote sensing for soil moisture estimation in mountainous regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在山区使用卫星遥感进行土壤湿度估计时，通常会遇到哪些挑战？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Challenges include the influence of strong forcing errors from biased rainfall input and inadequate model physics, which can affect the accuracy and reliability of satellite-based soil moisture products in mountainous regions like the Tibetan Plateau.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 挑战包括来自偏差降雨输入的强迫误差的影响以及模型物理的不充分，这可能会影响像青藏高原这样的山区卫星土壤湿度产品的准确性和可靠性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might data collection methods struggle to achieve adequate spatial and temporal resolution over the Tibetan Plateau, and what are some expected consequences of these challenges?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 数据收集方法在青藏高原上可能难以实现足够的空间和时间分辨率，原因可能包括地形复杂、气候条件恶劣、交通不便以及人类活动影响等。这些挑战的预期后果包括数据的准确性和可靠性降低、对环境变化的监测能力减弱，以及在制定政策和管理措施时缺乏必要的信息支持。
Expectation.AnswerEn: Data collection methods over the Tibetan Plateau often face challenges due to the sparse distribution of radiosonde stations and the region's high altitude. This can lead to lower resolution and potential biases in the data, impacting the accuracy of studies on atmospheric and climate characteristics. As a result, researchers may expect difficulties in capturing detailed spatial and temporal variations of atmospheric phenomena.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在青藏 Plateau 上的数据收集方法常常面临挑战，因为气象探空站的分布稀疏且该地区海拔较高。这可能导致数据的分辨率较低，并可能引入偏差，从而影响对大气和气候特征研究的准确性。因此，研究人员可能会预期在捕捉大气现象的详细空间和时间变化方面会遇到困难。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the expectations for improving the accuracy of soil moisture data collection over the Tibetan Plateau, and why might current satellite retrieval methods fall short?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 对改善青藏高原土壤湿度数据收集的期望是什么，当前卫星遥感方法为何可能不足？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The expectation is that by integrating satellite remote sensing data with dynamic models, such as in a Land Data Assimilation System (LDAS), the accuracy of soil moisture data collection can be improved. Current satellite retrieval methods may fall short due to strong forcing errors from biased rainfall input and inadequate model physics, which can lead to less reliable soil moisture estimates.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 预计通过将卫星遥感数据与动态模型（如土地数据同化系统LDAS）相结合，可以提高土壤湿度数据收集的准确性。目前的卫星反演方法可能由于偏差降雨输入造成的强迫误差和模型物理不足而不够可靠，从而导致土壤湿度估计的可靠性降低。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the anticipated benefits of using COSMIC radio occultation data for analyzing temperature structure over the Tibetan Plateau, and what challenges do researchers expect to encounter?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 使用COSMIC无线电掩蔽数据分析青藏 Plateau的温度结构的预期好处是什么，以及研究人员预计会遇到哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The use of COSMIC radio occultation data is expected to provide high vertical resolution temperature profiles which can improve understanding of the temperature structure and tropopause characteristics over the Tibetan Plateau. However, researchers might encounter challenges related to ensuring data quality and managing the inherent uncertainty in radio occultation measurements, which could affect the precision of atmospheric analysis.
Expectation.AnswerCn: COSMIC无线电掩蔽数据的使用预计将提供高垂直分辨率的温度剖面，从而改善对青藏高原温度结构和对流层顶特征的理解。然而，研究人员可能会面临与确保数据质量和管理无线电掩蔽测量固有不确定性相关的挑战，这可能会影响大气分析的精确性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your evaluation of the effectiveness of using GPS water vapor and AWS data for understanding water cycle characteristics on the Tibetan Plateau?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我对使用GPS水汽和自动气象站（AWS）数据来理解青藏高原水循环特征的有效性进行评估。
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The use of GPS water vapor and AWS data is effective in understanding the water cycle characteristics on the Tibetan Plateau due to the detailed observation content provided, such as total delay, precipitable water, and various atmospheric conditions measured at multiple stations. However, challenges such as spatial and temporal scarcity of data and potential biases in observations due to the high altitude and complex terrain must be addressed to fully leverage these data collection methods.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 使用GPS水汽和自动气象站（AWS）数据在理解青藏 Plateau的水循环特征方面是有效的，因为这些数据提供了详细的观测内容，如总延迟、可降水量以及在多个站点测量的各种大气条件。然而，数据在空间和时间上的稀缺性以及由于高海拔和复杂地形导致的观测潜在偏差等挑战必须得到解决，以充分利用这些数据收集方法。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please provide an analysis of the challenges faced in collecting high-resolution atmospheric data over the Tibetan Plateau and suggest potential methods to overcome these challenges.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请提供对在青藏 Plateau 收集高分辨率大气数据所面临挑战的分析，并建议克服这些挑战的潜在方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The challenges in collecting high-resolution atmospheric data over the Tibetan Plateau include the sparse distribution of radiosonde stations, which are mainly located in the eastern half of the plateau, and their low average altitude compared to the overall elevation of the region. Additionally, the temporal frequency of radiosonde observations is limited to 12-hour intervals, and there have been substantial changes in instrumentation over time. Potential methods to overcome these challenges include utilizing satellite-based systems like the Constellation Observing System for Meteorology, Ionosphere, and Climate (COSMIC), which can provide high-resolution temperature profiles, and implementing more advanced data assimilation techniques to improve spatial and temporal coverage.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在收集高分辨率大气数据时，青藏高原面临的挑战包括气象探测站的稀疏分布，这些站点主要位于高原的东半部分，且其平均海拔相较于该地区的整体海拔较低。此外，气象探测的时间频率仅限于每12小时一次，并且仪器设备在时间上经历了显著变化。克服这些挑战的潜在方法包括利用卫星系统，如气象、电离层和气候观测星座系统（COSMIC），该系统可以提供高分辨率的温度剖面，并实施更先进的数据同化技术，以改善空间和时间覆盖。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore potential datasets that could be integrated with land data assimilation systems (LDAS) to enhance soil moisture and energy flux simulations over the Tibetan Plateau.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探索可以与土地数据同化系统（LDAS）集成的潜在数据集，以增强对青藏高原的土壤湿度和能量通量模拟。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets that could be integrated with LDAS to enhance simulations include passive microwave remote sensing data such as the Advanced Microwave Scanning Radiometers for EOS (AMSR-E) brightness temperatures, which provide surface soil moisture measurements. Additionally, global reanalysis datasets like the National Centers for Environmental Prediction/National Center for Atmospheric Research (NCEP/NCAR) reanalysis could be used as forcing data. The integration of these datasets with LDAS can improve the accuracy of soil moisture and energy flux simulations, especially in ungauged or poorly gauged regions.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 可以与LDAS集成的潜在数据集包括被动微波遥感数据，如EOS的先进微波扫描辐射仪（AMSR-E）亮温，这些数据提供了表层土壤湿度测量。此外，全球再分析数据集，如国家环境预报中心/国家大气研究中心（NCEP/NCAR）再分析数据，也可以用作强迫数据。将这些数据集与LDAS集成可以提高土壤湿度和能量通量模拟的准确性，特别是在无监测或监测不足的地区。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please summarize the methodologies for comparing tropopause height over different regions using satellite data and discuss their effectiveness.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 总结使用卫星数据比较不同地区对流层顶高度的方法论，并讨论其有效性。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Methodologies for comparing tropopause height over different regions using satellite data include using the Formosa Satellite 3 (FORMOSAT-3)/COSMIC radio occultation data. This approach provides high-resolution temperature profiles, allowing for the comparison of tropopause height and temperature variations over the Tibetan Plateau and a similar latitudinal plain. The effectiveness of this method lies in its ability to capture the temperature structure and tropopause characteristics with higher accuracy than traditional radiosonde or reanalysis data, which suffer from lower resolution and biases. The COSMIC data's high vertical resolution enables detailed analysis of the lapse rate tropopause and its correlation with atmospheric thermal properties.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 比较不同地区对流层顶高度的方法之一是使用福尔摩沙卫星3号（FORMOSAT-3）/COSMIC无线电掩蔽数据。这种方法提供了高分辨率的温度剖面，允许对青藏高原和类似纬度平原的对流层顶高度和温度变化进行比较。这种方法的有效性在于其能够比传统的探空仪或再分析数据更高精度地捕捉温度结构和对流层顶特征，因为后者存在较低的分辨率和偏差。COSMIC数据的高垂直分辨率使得对温度递减率对流层顶及其与大气热特性的相关性进行详细分析成为可能。
